title: Reagan Airport Type
content:
Hello,

I spotted this on a recent trip to Washington at Reagan airport and was intrigued by the extended "Northwest" type. The flat ends of the S threw me off because initially I thought this was as Aksidenz with the straight leg of the R. Any ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101028142204im_/http:/typophile.com/files/reagan-gate-small_5317.jpg)
author: James Gareth

comments.content: This may be one of the many predigital Helvetica clones. [ITC Blair](http://web.archive.org/web/20101028142204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_blair_bold/?sample_text=northwest&sample_size=45) and [Trade Gothic Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20101028142204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/trade_gothic_lt_std_bold_extended_ot/?sample_text=NORTHWEST&sample_size=48) are also similar, albeit with the angled 'S' ends.

And there's [Titling Gothic Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20101028142204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/font_bureau/titling_gothic_wide_bold/?sample_text=NORTHWEST) which does have a flat-ended 'S' but whose rounds are more square.

Does Akzidenz Grotesk have an extended cut? Maybe it's that. EDIT: Yes it does, but I can't seem to find a type tester on the Berthold site to type "Northwest."

I think House Industries did a custom font for Dulles, but that's not the same airport right? Reagan used to be Washington International, right?

David

It’s not AG, which does have the angled-ended ‘S’.  
@ adnix: Try myfonts.com for type testing or fontshop.com, for Stephen ;-)

Unfortunately, FontShop doesn't carry Berthold fonts so you can't test 'er there. But here's [Akzidenz Bold Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20101028142204/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-be/bold-extended/testdrive.html?refby=typographica) on MyFonts. That could be it.

Maybe it's custom from back in the day. Reminds me of the old Delta Airlines logo font

David

Stephen,  
i don't think it's Akzidenz Bold Extended...look at the ‘W’ the prongs are too wide.
I think it's Venus Extra Bold Extended. I know of no digital version, but will try and upload a scan from an old VGC catalog later.

Scangraphic has a [Venus Bold Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20101028142204/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/scangraphic/venus_sb_bold_extended/?sample_text=NORTHWEST&sample_size=45) with a very funky flared 'S'. And there's Font Bureau's [Vonness](http://web.archive.org/web/20101028142204/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Vonness).

Well, Vonness is definitely "loosely based ... ". I'm not sure why Scangraphics' version differs.

From the Photo Typositor Catalog (VGC), 8th Edition:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101028142204im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VenusXb_3630.jpg)
Either that or Annonce Grotesque, but the differences between these two are minimal.
The difference would be that [Annonce](http://web.archive.org/web/20101028142204/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=annonce) is available digitally. Very nice find, Yves.

Hi James,  
can you help me to design some labels for nutritional products? I designed logo, but it is not very good. I will appreciate it if you can help me out. my email: [brown652003@hotmail.com](mailto:brown652003@hotmail.com)  
Thanks!

Bing
